result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. Bollig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES.  MAY BE SERVED IN ANY COUNTY IN THE STATE OF WISCONSIN PURSUANT TO WI. STAT. 303.08(6).  TO COMMENCE ON/BEFORE 11/8/2014 AT 8:00 A.M.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

TO APPEAR AND ACKNOWLEDGMENT OF RIGHTS
